title.narrative: COMMUNITIES AND SCHOOLS IN RURAL AREAS,INCREASE USE OF BASIC SANITATION.

description.narrative: Communities and schools, particularly in rural areas, increase use of â€œbasicâ€ sanitation and practise handwashing with soap, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Households in rural and urban areas have increased access to safe, â€œbasicâ€ and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in emergency and non- emergencysituations.

sector.narrative: System strengthening - Mental health and psychosocial support for children, adolescents and teachers in education
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities and schools, particularly in rural areas, increase use of ?basic? sanitation and practise handwashing with soap

description.narrative: With UNICEF support during 2021, 14,515 people gained access to basic sanitation and handwashing while 85 schools and 27 health centres;were also provided with handwashing facilities. Over 2 million people were reached with messages on safe hygiene practices and COVID-19 infection prevention and control through interpersonal communication and mass media. As part of the effort to support an effective COVID-19 response, an IPC specialist was seconded to MOH to provide technical assistance for effective IPC. Critical WASH supplies provided by UNICEF benefited over 3,000 displaced people from DRC.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/12/2021
